comments:
RC2

1. turn on Watch/Edit and 'Always prompt' on the CVS-Edit preference page
2. check out a Java project containing a Java source file
3. Open a CU, select it in the package explorer and invoke 'Format'
   The file is left modified but not saved
4. Save the file, but when prompted to perform edit say 'no'.
5. A new dialog shows up 'Exception running validator code'
  The following stack trace is printed in the log

I suspect format did not call validateEdit

Created an attachment (id=12171)
proposed fix

also fixes Organize Imports on multiple files.

This does not seem to be the right fix. Filebuffers provide a protocol for 
state validation.

Kai suggests to use IFileBuffer.validateState instead of jdt.ui's 
Resources.makeCommittable(file, null).

Resources.makeCommittable(file, null) was what we had before so I think it's 
safer to do that.

The proposed patch is not low risk, but I think we have to do this otherwise, 
Organize Import doesn't do validateEdit at all.

I checked that the we are now correctly asked to validate the edit before the
format is allowed to go through. 
However, when I say "no" the the edit validation, the "Format" action disappears
from the editor context menu. What I would expect is for the format action to
still be available and to trigger another validateEdit when I try it again. 
The "Organize imports" action works correctly.
Reopening because we lose Formatting and general editing capability.

Just to make this clear: I wasn't able to editr after I had refused the
validateEdit. This has nothing to do with the "format" action. Moving to JDT-Text
Thomas this is not related. Please file separate bug report(s)
